On the other hand, whiskeys are loved by men because they are more of high-class indicator. This is unlike beer that is mainly meant for social drinking and champagne that are meant for celebrations.


Whiskeys In Kenya

whisky are strong drinks that are made from fermentation of grains like barley, corn, rye, wheat and rice. The fermented base is then aged in distilled over still pots then aged on oak wood barrels to gain flavours and improve the taste. The grains used could either be malted of not malted. Every distillery has a different way of making their whisky to make it unique in the market. For example, Tennessee whisky are filtered over charcoal to give them the mellow taste. Visit our online whisky shop for reliable whisky delivery Nairobi. The following are whisky brands in Kenya.

  • Tennessee whiskey

Wines In Kenya

Wines are made by fermenting grapes. Wine is one of the most complex category of alcohol because its taste is largely influenced by the grapes used, climatic conditions of the region where the grapes are grown and also the soil conditions. This explains why wines made from the same grape but from different region may have different tastes. a the following are wine brands in Kenya;

  • dry red wines
  • sweet white wines
  • dry white wines
  • port wines
  • rose wines
  • sparkling wines
  • champagne
  • vermouth wines


Red Wines In Kenya

Wines are also subdivided into varietal wines and blends. Varietal wines are those wines that are produces from one or two grapes and have those grapes indicated on the bottle. On the other hand, blends are those wines that produced from mixing different grapes. The blending of different grapes is to increase flavours and also improve the taste. Red wines are the best when it comes to pairing them with meals because they can almost be paired with any type of food. Red wines are better enjoyed in bell shaped glasses at room temperature. When cold, their flavours are over emphasized and when hot they might taste bitter. Red wines have higher concentration of tannins that is found on the skin of the grapes which results to improvement in quality with the increase of their shelf life. There are so many healthy benefits in drinking red wines than white wines. Actually, white wines are meant for refreshments. To gain this benefits, it is advisable for men to take at least two glasses of wine per day and for ladies to take at least one glass of wine per day. However, if you over drink wine, just like other types of alcohol, the health benefits might be lost and instead have negative results like alcohol addiction which leads to alcoholism. Visit our online wine shop to order for the best wines in Kenya. The following are red wine brands in Kenya.

  • Merlot
  • Pinotage
  • Pinot Noir
  • Shiraz/Syrah
  • Malbec
  • Zinfandel
  • Baronne (Cabernet Sauvignon Shiraz)


White Wines In Kenya

White wines are the best wines when it comes to pairing wine with light meals. They are also excellent choices when it comes to refreshment because they are better enjoy chilled. When arriving home from a scorching sun and a tedious day, a glass of white wine will do miracle to your body. White wines are generally low in concentration of tannins because they have the skin of their grapes peeled before fermentation hence they don’t gain much from aging. Actually, the older the white wines becomes the lower their quality goes. Dial a wine in Nairobi today for the best wine prices in Kenya. The following are white wines brands in Kenya.


Types of White in Kenya

  • Sauvignon Blanc
  • Chenin blanc
  • Riesling
  • Chardonnay
  • Pinot Grigio
  • Pinot Gris

title: Types Of Wine In Kenya
body:
Wines are alcoholic drinks made from fermenting grapes. Wines in Kenya are among the popular alcoholic drinks like whisky, vodka, cognac, rum, gin, liqueur, champagne, beer and tequila. One of the famous wine enthusiast said, “a meal without wine is called breakfast”. It is for this reason wine is the most drunk in all types of alcohol in Kenya after beer. This article will try to evaluate wine delivery Nairobi and how you can buy wine online in Kenya. We will also check different types of wines in Kenya and their prices.


Wines In Kenya

You can buy wine online in Kenya from online wine shops in Nairobi CBD and have it delivered to your doorstep in minutes. There are so many wine brands in Kenya because we import wines from different countries around the globe. The taste of wine is influenced by the grapes used to make it and where those grapes are grown. Wines made from the same grape but in different countries could taste differently depending on the climatic conditions and soil conditions where the grapes are grown. Are you looking for the most expensive wine in Kenya or the best wines in Kenya and their prices? Visit our online wine shop and have you favourite bottle finding it’s way to your house.


Types of Wine

  • sweet red wines
  • dry red wines
  • sweet white wines
  • dry white wines
  • rose wines
  • port wines
  • champagne
  • sparkling wines
  • vermouth wines
  • fortified wines
  • Non-alcoholic wines


Red wines and white wines are the most popular wines in Kenya. However, these two types of wines are prepared differently making them have different colour, taste and flavours. Wines are made from grapes. White grapes make white wines while red grapes make red wines, white wines and also rose wines. For red grapes to make white wines, they have their skin pilled of leaving the inner part of the grape that is not red. On the other hand, for red grapes to make rose wines, they are first crushed with their skin but have the skin removed before fermentation. This explains why red wines have so many similarities with rose wines.


Red wine Types

Let’s now focus on red wines in details. Red wines as we said earlier are prepared from dark grapes. If you have noticed, is said dark grapes but not red grapes. This means that all dark grapes can be used to make red wines and that why these wines have varying colours dark to reddish. The grapes are crushed and fermented together with their skin make the wine to have higher concentration tannins. It is this tannins that make red wine benefit from aging. Red wines are also categorised in terms wine bodies. This is determined by the wine viscosity which is largely influenced by alcohol percentage of the wine.


Wine Bodies

  • Full Bodies – It is comprised of wines with alcohol percentage of more 13%. Good examples are; most Nederburg, Asconi Pastoral, Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz, Port wines, Zinfandel and Fortified Dessert Wines.
  • Medium Bodies – It is comprised with wines of alcohol percentage beloe 13.5% but above 12.5%. Good examples are; Namaqua, Overmeer, Asconi Kagor Lux, Robertson, Frontera, Altar Wine, Lambrusco, Cellar Cask and most Pinot Grigio.
  • Light Bodies – It is comprises of wines below 12.5 % alcohol percentage. Good examples are ; 4th Street, Four Cousins, Nederburg Riesling, Saint Celine and Versus

Red wines are the best when it comes to pairing wine with food because they pair well with almost all types of food. However, they give the best combination when it comes heavy meal like red meat. The following are the types of red wines in Kenya.


Red Wines Types in Kenya

  • Cabernet Sauvignon
  • Shiraz/Syrah
  • Merlot
  • Malbec
  • Pinotage
  • Pinot Noir
  • Zinfandel
  • Baronne (Cabernet Sauvignon Shiraz)

Are you looking for the best wines in Kenya and their prices? Drinks Delivery Kenya offers you the best wines and spirits prices list to add to reliable drinks delivery Nairobi.


Types of White Wines

White wines are made from both dark skinned grapes and white grapes. Should a distillery be using red grapes, they have to peel out their skin before crushing and fermentation. This explains the varying color white wines that goes from hues of green, light grey, straw, yellow or gold. White wines are better enjoyed while chilled in bell shaped glasses. They are mainly meant for refreshment but they can also be used to pair with light food. The following are the white wine brands in Kenya that you will get should need wine delivery services in Nairobi city.


Types of White Wines in Kenya

  • Sauvignon Blanc
  • Chenin Blanc
  • Chardonnay
  • Riesling
  • Pinot Grigio
  • Pinot Gris
  • Moscato


Rose Wines

Rose wine are pink in colour. They are made from dark grapes like the one that make red wines but the skin is removed after crushing before fermentation. This gives the wine a pinkish colour. This is the reason some people call them the pink wine. Rose wines are good for pairing with light meals or refreshment. Most of these wines are sweet rose wines but there are few dry rose wines. Are you looking for the best rose wines or top rose wines? Don’t fret because Drinks Delivery Kenya got your back the best rose wine bottles. Rose wines are divided into sparkling rose wines and non-sparkling rose wines. The following are the most popular rose wines in Kenya.


Rose Wines Brands in Kenya and Their Prices

  • Namaqua sweet rose 5 litres @ Ksh 3,500
  • 4th Street sweet rose 5 litres @ Ksh 3,500
  • 4th Street sweet rose 1.5 litres @ Ksh 2,200
  • 4th Street sweet rose 750ml @ Ksh 1,200
  • Four Cousins sweet rose 1.5 litres @ Ksh 2,200
  • Four Cousins sweet rose 750ml @ Ksh 1,200
  • Leleshwa sweet rose 750ml @ Ksh 1,200
  • Nederburg rose 750ml @ Ksh 2,000
  • Overmeer sweet rose 5 litres @ Ksh 3,500
  • Orange River Cellars sweet rose 5 litres @ Ksh 3,500
  • Mateus sweet rose 750ml @ Ksh 2,700
  • Fragolino sparkling rose wine 750ml @ Ksh 1,800
  • Abor Mist white sweet strawberry 750ml @ Ksh 1,700


Sparkling Wines

Sparkling wines are bubbly wines that are made with two fermentation processes. The second fermentation process is meant to add carbon dioxide that makes sparkling wines fizzy. Sparkling wines are meant for celebration because the pop up when shaken due to that carbon dioxide. However, some people still love to take these wines on normal occasions because of the nice feeling brought by the bubbles bursting on you tongue when sipping them. Sparkling wines are better enjoy chilled with tall slender glasses. There are the methods that are use to make sparkling wines; Bulk Chamat, Traditional Method (Methode Champenoise) and bottle transfer method. Sparkling wines have different names in different countries. In Spain the are called Cava, in Italy they are called Prosecco and in France they are called Champagne in the champagne region of France while in all other region of France they are called Cremant The quality of the sparkling method is graded by its mousse. The finer the mousse the higher the quality of the sparkling wine. Sparkling wines are subdivided into rose sparkling wines, red sparkling wines and white sparkling wines. These wines could be sweet sparkling wines, dry sparkling wines or non-alcoholic sparkling wines. Dry sparkling wines are called brut sparkling wines. Buy rose wines online in Kenya and enjoy the best wine prices in Kenya. The following are the most popular sparkling wines in Kenya.


Sparkling Wine Brands in Kenya and Their Prices

  • Nederburg Cuvee Brut white dry sparkling wine 750ml @ Ksh 3,000
  • Chamdor red non-alcoholic sparkling wine 750ml @ Ksh 1,000
  • Chamdor white non-alcoholic sparkling wine 750ml @ Ksh 1,000
  • Prosecco sparkling wine 750ml @ Ksh 3,500
  • Canti Prosecco sparkling wine 750ml @ Ksh 3,500
  • Fragolino Duchessa red sparkling wine 750ml @ Ksh 1,800
  • Fragolino Duchessa white sparkling wine 750ml @ Ksh 1,800
  • Fragolino Bianco sparkling wines 750ml @ Ksh 1,800
  • Fragolino Rosso sparkling wines 750ml @ Ksh 1,800
  • Pure Heaven non-alcoholic white sparkling wines 750ml @ Ksh 1,000
  • Pure Heaven non-alcoholic red sparkling wines 750ml @ Ksh 1,000
  • Four Cousins red sparkling wines 750ml @ Ksh 2,000
  • Royalty non-alcoholic red sparkling wines 750ml @ Ksh 1,000


Champagne

Champagnes are also sparkling wines only that they have specific method of preparation, specific grapes and they must be prepared specifically in Champagne region of France. The method used to prepare champagne is called Traditional method or Methode Champenoise. The grapes use to make champagne are; Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay. Champagnes are classified as vintage and non-vintage champagnes. Champagne are regarded as the most expensive wines in Kenya. Just like the other sparkling wines that are meant for celebrations, champagne are also the best for celebrations and are also considered to be the highest quality wines. Dry champagne are called brut champagnes. You can buy champagne online in Kenya and enjoy the most reliable champagne delivery Nairobi.

Vintage champagnes - These champagnes are prepared from the best grapes of a particular year and they must be aged for a minimum of three years. This explains why vintage champagnes are not prepared every year. Vintage champagne are regarded as the best quality champagnes. Vintage Champagnes are considered to be the best champagne brands. Good examples of vintage champagnes are as follows;


Vintage Champagne Brands in Kenya and Their Prices

  • Moet & Chandon Imperial Brut 750ml @ Ksh 6,500
  • Moet & Chandon Imperial Rose 750ml @ Ksh 8,000
  • Moet & Chandon Imperial Nectar 750ml @ Ksh 9,500
  • Dom Perignon 750ml @ Ksh 20,000
  • Laurent Pierre Brut 750ml @ Ksh 7,000
  • Veuve Clicquot Brut 750ml @ Ksh 9,000
  • Veuve Clicquot Rose 750ml @ Ksh 10,000
  • Perrier Jouet 750ml @ Ksh 13,000
  • GH Mumm Cordon Rounge Brut 750ml @ Ksh 8,000
  • Piper Heidscieck 750ml @ Ksh 7,000


  • Non-Vintage champagne – These champagnes are prepared every year and they are aged for at least 15 months. Though non-vintage champagnes are not regarded as the best quality in comparison to vintage champagnes, they are better quality compared to other sparkling wines. Unlike vintage champagnes that are prepared from grapes of one single harvest from a particular year, non-vintage champagnes are prepared from grapes of multiple harvests. Good examples of non-vintage champagnes are as follows;


Non-vintage Champagnes Brands in Kenya and Their Prices

  • Taittinger Brut 750ml @ Ksh 8,000
  • Belaire Brut 750ml @ Ksh 6,000
  • Belaire Rose 750ml @ Ksh 6,000
  • Belaire Luxe 750ml @ Ksh 6,000
  • Belaire Gold 750ml @ Ksh 6,000
  • GH Mumm Cordon Rounge Brut 750ml @ Ksh 8,000


Non alcoholic Wines

These are the wines that are have zero alcohol percentage. They are purposely meant for celebrations and to be precise christian wedding ceremonies. These wines are also used for celebrations on other functions where people don’t drink alcoholic beverages. Non alcoholic wines could be red wines, white wines, rose wines or sparkling wines. You can buy non alcoholic wine online for the best wine prices in Kenya. The following are non alcoholic wines in Kenya.


Non Alcoholic Wine Brands in Kenya and Their prices

  • Chamdor red 750ml @ Ksh 1,000
  • Chamdor white 750ml @ Ksh 1,000
  • Royalty White Celebration Drink 750ml @ Ksh 1,000
  • Lambrusco Dell’emillia 750ml @ Ksh 1,800
  • Pure Heaven White Celebration Drink 750ml @ Ksh 1,000
  • Pure Heaven Red Celebration Drink 750ml @ Ksh 1,000


Vermouth wines

Vermouth are wines that are made clear grapes contrarily to the opinion of the many that vermouth are made from spirits. Vermouth are fortified wines which means they are flavoured wines and aromatized wines. To increase their alcohol percentage, they are added neutral alcohol like clear spirits e.g brandy. They are then flavoured with spices, botanicals and herbs. Red vermouth wines originated from Italy while white and dry vermouth originated from France. Vermouth wines are characterized with the following tastes and flavours; wine, cocoa, herbs and toffee. Other fortified wines are port wines which are wines that a produced from Portugal.


Types of vermouth wines in Kenya;

  • red vermouth
  • white vermouth
  • sweet vermouth
  • dry vermouth


Vermouth Wine Brands in Kenya

  • Cinzano Bianco 750ml @ Ksh 2,000
  • Cinzano Bianco 1 litre @ Ksh 2,500
  • Martini Bianco 750ml @ Ksh 2,000
  • Martini Bianco 1 litre @ Ksh 2,500
  • Martini Rosso 750ml @ Ksh 2,000
  • Martini Rosso 1 litre @ Ksh 2,500
  • Martini Extra Dry 750ml @ Ksh 2,000
  • Martini Extra Dry 1 litre @ Ksh 2,500


Fortified Wines

These are wines that have clear spirit added to them to increase their alcohol percentage. The common spirit that is added is brandy. The two most common types of fortified wines are port wines and vermouth wines. These wines may also be flavoured wines or aromatized wines. This is done by adding herbs, spices, botanical and may be caramel. Fortified wines are commonly produced in Portugal, France, Italy and Germany.


Port Wines

Port wines are fortified wines that are produced in Portugal. These wines have the following flavours; blackberry, strawberry, chocolate, caramel and cinnamon. Port wines are among the most expensive wines in Kenya. These wines comes in two variations; aged and non age ones. The aged port wines are called Tawny Port.


Port Types of Wines

  • red port wines
  • white port wines
  • Rose port wines
  • tawny port wines


Port Wine Brands in Kenya and Their prices

  • Sandeman Ruby Porto 750ml @ Ksh 2,800
  • Sandeman Ruby Porto 1 litre @ Ksh 3,000
  • Cockburns Fine Tawny 750ml @ Ksh 2,800
  • Cockburns Fine Tawny 1 litre @ Ksh 3,000
  • Cockburns Fine Ruby 1 litre @ Ksh 3,000
  • Porto Cruz Tawny 750ml @ Ksh 2,800
  • Porto Cruz Tawny 1 litre @ Ksh 3,000
  • Porto Cruz Special Reserve 750ml @ Ksh 3,500


In conclusion, Drinks Delivery Kenya is among the leading wine Shop in Nairobi CBD. We stock different types of wines. Beside the retail prices on the website, we also give wines and spirits wholesale prices in Kenya. This is important mostly to those people who own wines and spirit shops and also pubs. title: Most Expensive Wines in Kenya
body:
Wine is the most palatable alcoholic drink in Kenya. This is because wines are made from the fermentation of grapes and have low alcoholic percentage ranging from 5% to 21%. Actually, this is the lowest alcohol percentage levels after beers. The taste and the color of the wine is determined by the grapes from which it is made from. Are you looking for the best wines in Kenya and their prices? Drinks Delivery Kenya is an online wine shop located in Nairobi CBD and we stock different types of wines in Kenya from all the corners of the world. The best thing is that you can now buy wine online in Kenya and enjoy reliable wine delivery Nairobi. This article will try to focus on wine prices in Kenya. We will particularly focus on the most expensive wines in Kenya and the reason as to why their prices is higher than the other wines.

Before we dive into our topic, it will be great to mention all the wine brands in Kenya. We have a wide collection of wines since we shop wine online from all corners of the globe to ensure we have the best wines in Kenya. The following are among the popular wines in Kenya.


Types Of Wines In Kenya

  1. sweet red wines
  2. sweet white wines
  3. dry red wines
  4. dry white wines
  5. rose wines
  6. sparkling wines
  7. port wines
  8. champagnes
  9. fortified wines
  10. vermouth wines


You can order wine online to enjoy reliable wine delivery services. Some of the locations that we do alcohol delivery includes; Nairobi CBD, Westlands, Parklands, South B, South C, Emabakassi, Upper Hill, Kiliamani, Kileleshwa, Lavington, Jamhuri Estate, Runda Estate, Ruaka, Makandara, Brookside Drive, Muthangari Drive, Four Ways Junction, Jacaranda Gardens, Nyayo Estate, Muthaiga North, Karen, Ngong, Kiambu, Kasarani, Kahawa West, Kahawa Wendani, Kahawa Sukari, Zimmerman, Riara Road, Naivasha road, Industrial area, Lower Kabete, along Limuru road, along Kiambu road, along Thika road, along Waiyaki way, along Ngong road, along Jogoo road, along Mombasa road and along Juja road.


Prices of wines in Kenya range from Ksh 1,000 to Ksh 28,000. This price range is justified by several factors as follows;

Factors Affecting Price of Wine

  • Grapes used in production
  • The method used in production
  • Time used in production


Wine Grapes

There are so many wine grapes in the world but only a few of them are used to make wine. The taste of wine is influenced by the grapes from which it is produced. Same grape might have different taste depending on where its grown due to climatic factors and soil conditions. Climatic conditions also hinder some grapes from growing in particular regions completely. Dark grapes are used to make red wines while the white grapes are used to make white wines. Rose wine is made from dark grapes, however, the grapes must have their skin removed after crushing them. This is why rose wines are pink in color and also share a lot of similarities with red wines. White wines can also be made from red grapes but the grapes must have their skin peeled before crushing and fermentation. Sometimes wines are made from blending different grapes. This is done to improve the quality and the taste of the wines. Good examples of blended wines are Cellar Cask, Four Cousins, 4th Street, Altar wine, Robertson Winery and Saint Celine. The following are the most popular wine grapes that are used to make wines. These grapes are used to make either red wines or white wines.


Popular Wine Grapes Varietals

  1. Cabernet Sauvignon
  2. Sauvignon Blanc
  3. Chenin Blanc ( Stein )
  4. Chardonnay
  5. Merlot
  6. Malbec
  7. Shiraz / Syrah
  8. Pinotage
  9. Zinfandel
  10. Baronne ( Cabernet Sauvignon Shiraz )
  11. Pinot Noir
  12.  Pinot Grigio
  13. Pinot Gris
  14. Riesling
  15. Moscato


Wines are classified as blends or varietals. Blends are those wines that are made from several inferior grapes while varietals are those wines that are made from one or two superior grapes and have those grapes indicated on the bottle. Some grapes can only grow in particular regions while others are expensive to grow. Wines made from inferior grapes are cheap while wines made from superior and rare grapes are quite expensive. Let’s take the case of sparkling wines and champagne. Champagnes are made from three superior grapes; Chardonnay, Pinot Meunier, and Pinot Noir. On the other hand, sparkling wines are made from even blends of inferior grapes. This makes champagne more expensive in comparison with other sparkling wines. A good example of sparkling wine that is made from a blend of grapes is Four Cousin Sparkling wine. However, there are still other sparkling wines that follow all the rules of champagne production so they are expensive than other sparkling wines but a bit cheaper in comparison with champagne. A good example of such a sparkling wine is Prosecco. This is a sparkling made in Italy. 


Wine Production Method

Red wines, white wines, and rose wines are produced through the same method. However, when it comes to fortified wines like vermouth and port wines the method is different because there is adding of clear brandy increase the alcohol concentration and flavoring with herbs to improve the taste. The most complex ones are sparkling wines and champagnes. When it comes to this two option, they undergo two fermentation processes to add carbon dioxide that makes them fizzy and pop up during celebrations when they are shaken. The following are the three methods used to make sparkling wines and champagnes;

The traditional method (Methode Champenoise)

Bulk Chamat

Bottle Transfer Method

The traditional method is the most complex one among the three methods. It is too technical and time taking. The technicality of every wine production method is what brings the price variance.


Time Used in Production

Different wine production method have different time span. Also, different wines are produced for a different amount of time. For example, vintage champagnes are aged for a minimum of three years while non-vintage champagnes are aged for 15 months. The same case applies to the port wines where some of them are not aged while others are aged. The aged port wines are called tawny port. During aging, evaporation takes place leaving behind a concentrated wine which means the quality increases but also the volume of the wine reduces. Due to the reduction in volume, it makes every milliliter of the wine cost more than the non-aged wines. 


In conclusion, the champagne is the most expensive wines in Kenya followed by Port wines. This is because they use superior grapes, complex production method and also they are aged for some time. Are you looking for the best wines and spirits prices in Kenya? Drinks Delivery Kenya is among reliable wines shops in Nairobi CBD offering free and fast alcohol delivery. Apart from wine delivery in Nairobi, the other most popular service we offer is whisky delivery Nairobi. Visit our online liquor store and the see different types of alcohol in Kenya. Among the benefits of shopping for alcohol online is the comfort dial a drink from your house and having the drink delivery done in minutes without having to step outside of your house. To make alcohol delivery Nairobi a service for all, we have extended our working hours to midnight. This is in line our vision of offering 24-hour alcohol delivery Nairobi. To make it better, we offer wines and spirits wholesale prices in Kenya. This is really important for people who are holding events or people who own wines and spirits or restaurants and pubs. Let’s join hands and keep thirst away. #KeepItDrinksDeliveryKenya !Cheers

title: Drinks Delivery
body:
Alcohol has become a basic need to many people living in Nairobi and Mombasa city. There is no party or event that will ever be termed as complete if the guest have not sipped some good wine or a great spirit. Even in our homes, a meal without a glass of wine is never complete. Actually, there is a saying that goes like this, “A meal without a glass of wine is called breakfast”. Now that we all love to enjoy our alcohol, the real question is how we get our drinks. Some people choose to go to clubs and others will choose to buy from wines and spirits shops. There are still some other people who are clever enough to buy alcohol online from online liquor stores and have it delivered right to their houses or office. With online shopping being the new trend in the city, ordering alcohol online is the best option of the three. In this article, we will be focusing on online alcohol delivery and the advantage of drinks delivery Nairobi.

Sometimes we are lucky enough to remember to pass by a local liquor store to buy our favourite drinks. This is great but there are several challenges that comes with local liquor shops. The following are some of the challenges that will make you not buy alcohol from local wines and spirits stores.

Inconveniences Of Local Wines and Spirits Shops

  • Most of the alcohol shops close as early as 6 PM
  • There are possibilities that your favourite drink is out of stock in that particular alcohol store
  • Most of the local wines and spirits have less variety to choose from
  • The prices in the local alcohol shops are quite high
  • There is no assurance of quality in this small liquor stores
  • Lack of parking around the whisky store or wine shop
  • There could be huge traffic to drive to the liquor store and back
  • There could be long queues in the liquor store as you are being checked out
  • Lack of comparison due to less variety in all types of alcohol in Kenya
  • Lack of alcohol knowledge; they can’t advise a newbie



On the other hand, going to a club is not advisable too. There are so many factors you need to consider when you want to go to a club. Most of the good clubs are located a long distance from us where you need to drive, take a cab, board a bus or a “boda-boda”. Let’s take a deeper look why going to a club is not advisable unless you are with your mates and the occasion really needs a club.

Disadvantages Of Clubbing Vs Online Alcohol Delivery Services

  • They sell drinks at exaggerated prices in comparison with online alcohol shops
  • The extra cost of taking a cab or driving your vehicle to the club and back
  • The risk of being mugged by the cab guys or thugs around the club
  • Discomfort from the loud and noisy music in clubs. It is even worse when two clubs are adjacent to each other.
  • Poor music system and poor selection of music from the DJ makes the whole clubbing thing boring
  • Some clubs are so explicit with waitress being more than half naked
  • There is no privacy between you and your lover while drinking in a club
  • Risk of being overcharged when you get drunk
  • Risk of unprotected sex when you are drunk which can lead to unwanted pregnancy and STDs
  • Risk of road accidents should you drive when drunk
  • Risk of huge fines from NTSA should you be found driving while drunk
  • Your vehicle could be stolen when you are drinking due to lack of security around the club
  • The risk of your drinks being drugged for you to get robbed

AS we have clearly shown, buying alcohol from local wines and spirits or clubbing are not appealing options. Yes you can opt to do either of them but by doing so you will be exposing yourself to so many risks.

Reasons To Buy Alcohol Online

meta: Whisky Delivery Nairobi. Order whisky online from the best online whisky stores and enjoy the best whisky prices in Kenya and wide variety of whisky brands
title: Whisky Delivery Nairobi – How To Enjoy Whiskey Like A Gentleman
body:
Did you know what you drink defines who you are? Ladies are known to drink wine, guys are known to drink beer but real gentlemen drink whiskey. Whisky is a dark spirit made from ageing a distillation of fermented grain mash. The ageing must be done in wooden casks which are sometimes charred. There are different categories of whisky depending on production method, country of production, style of whisky, how long the whisky is aged, grains used to produce the whisky and also whether the whiskey is flavoured or not. These six factors are the ones that influences whiskey prices in Kenya. In this article, we will talk about the seven tips on how to enjoy whisky like a gentleman. These tips will distinguish you from whisky amateurs and make you a whisky aficionado.

1. Pick your whisky wisely

The following are the main categories of whisky and within this categories, there are different brands. Different types of whisky have different taste so you might have to try all of them before you choose to settle down with one type of whisky. You might not love whisky for the first time due to its strong taste and smell but be sure if you try it three times in a row you will be a big fan of it. If you are a beer drinker it is the time you should graduate to whisky. Beers will give you a pot belly but whisky will restore your flat stomach. Some whisky brands have a superior taste, some are of high quality and some have the best flavours. The good thing is that Drinks Delivery Kenya, an online whisky shop in Nairobi CBD, stocks all types of whisky brands in Kenya. The following are the major types of whisky in Kenya that you might choose to explore to find your favourite one.

Types Of Whiskey In Kenya

  • Single Malt whisky
  • Blended Scotch whisky
  • Irish Whiskey
  • Tennessee & Bourbon Whiskey (American whiskey)
  • Japanese Whisky
  • Indian Whisky
  • Canadian Whisky

2. Know How To Drink Your Whisky

There are several ways you can enjoy your glass of whisky. However, you must have the recommended whisky glasses for you to enjoy the thrilling experience of drinking whisky. Different whisky brands have their recommended whisky glasses though there are general whisky glasses which are accepted for drinking whisky. Some whisky distilleries have gone a further step and branded their own glasses to ensure you feel a full attachment to their whisky brand. There is one golden rule while drinking whisky; don’t fill the glass. By ensuring the glass of whisky is at most half full gives whisky a room to breathe giving you a chance to inhale the flavours as you sip your whisky.

Let’s now focus on the main business of ensuring we enjoy maximum flavours of whisky when it goes down our thirst throat. The four ways you could enjoy whisky are as follows;

  • Drink the whisky neat – this is where you drink the whisky the way it is. You just pour it in the glass and sip it. This is mostly known with whiskey aficionados because they love the strong taste and smell of whisky.
  • Drink the whisky on the rocks – this is another way to expose the flavours of the whisky. The ice cubes chill the whisky and dilute it slightly cutting out that burning effect. First, put the ice cubes on the glass then add the whisky on top.
  • Drink whisky with water – you can expose some great flavours of whisky by adding some spring water or any still water to a glass with some whisky. Remember you only need to dilute the whisky a little bit, therefore, only add some little water. The water that will be added to the whisky needs to be at the same temperatures as the whisky because cold water might kill some good flavours of the whisky.
  • Drink whisky with chasers – besides water, there are other chasers that are great while drinking whisky. Some of the common chasers that are used with whiskey are tonic water, soda water, sodas, lime juice, fruit juices and beers.

3. Check The Age Of Whisky

This is one of the most important things for any whisky enthusiast. The older the whisky, the better the quality. However, there is a misconception around the colour of the whisky making us believe that the darker the whisky the better the quality. It is this misconception that has driven some whisky distilleries to add caramel on their whisky brands to make them look darker and appealing. In the real sense, the colour of the whisky is only supposed to tell us the wood barrel used to age the whisky because whisky takes the colour barrel in which it is aged. Some whisky like Macallan is not flavoured with caramel hence they look more clear yet they are full of flavours. Single malt whiskies and most of the blended whiskies have the number of the years they are aged indicated on the bottle. The reason for aged whiskies to have higher quality is due to evaporation of water while ageing in the barrels and also gaining more flavours from the wood during ageing. Some distilleries age their whisky in three different barrels to ensure the whisky has better flavours. To be realistic, you don’t expect great whisky that cost cheap. High-quality whiskies are expensive, smooth and have awesome flavours.

4. Take Whisky Any Time

Whisky is not for special times like birthdays, graduations and those other events that are memorable. Let those events be kept aside for popping a bottle of champagne or a high-quality sparkling wine. Any time is whisky drinking time...you might even take a sip of a high-quality whisky after breakfast before you step out for a long day. The great thing about whisky is that it gives someone the confidence of facing anything and also gives a relaxing effect when sipped in the evening after a long busy day. Find out that particular awesome whisky that will give awesome feeling any time you sip it. You could choose to enjoy single malt whisky or blended whisky. For single malt whisky, they are strong in smell and every distillery have a particular taste that is used as the trademark for that distillery. On the other hand, blended whiskies are a bit chilled and are mild in taste though they have more flavours gained from blending grain whisky and single malt whiskies. However, single malt whiskies are generally expensive than the blended whiskies though there are specially blended whiskies that are really expensive like Johnnie Walker Odyssey @ Ksh 150,000 and Johnnie Walker King George V @ Ksh 75,000.

5. Buy Whisky Online In Kenya

In comparison with local wines and spirits in Kenya, online liquor stores and particularly whisky shops are your best bet when it comes to buying whisky. These online alcohol shops offer a wide variety of whisky brands in Kenya in addition to offering the convenience of making an order from the comfort of your home. Do you want to restock that empty liquor cabinet? Reach out for your phone or computer and search for an online whiskey store that offers reliable whisky delivery Nairobi, place your alcohol order, check out the cart with your location address and wait for a knock on your front door. I guess that is much easier than getting stuck in traffic, struggling to get parking space close to the wines and spirits, moving up and down in a liquor store to find your favourite drinks, queuing to be checked out and finally ferrying all the bottles to your house hoping you don’t hit a bump to avoid breakage. Online alcohol shops also offer flexibility in payments method where you can pay via cash, MPESA till number and also swipe your credit or debit card. Besides the fast alcohol delivery Nairobi that takes less than 30 minutes, online wines and spirits also offer the best whisky prices in Kenya which means that you shop for more drinks and still remain within your budget.

6. Install Alcohol Delivery App

For convenience and simplicity of ordering whisky online, install an alcohol delivery app that is easy and comfortable to use. Installing a liquor delivery app is like moving with your liquor cabinet wherever you go because you can dial a delivery any time and have the drinks delivered within minutes. With an app, you don’t have to go online again looking for your favourite whisky plus can also save your favourite drinks by clicking the favourite button. A good alcohol delivery app that can advise you to install is Nairobi Drinks Alcohol Delivery App. This app is already on Google PlayStore and you can click the link below to download it and be one single tap away from your best whisky.

https://play.google.com/store/search?q=nairobi+drinks&c=apps

7. Establish Yourself With One Online Liquor Store

When you maintain your loyalty to one liquor store you will certainly enjoy discounted alcohol prices plus loyalty gifts once in a while. At the same time, by maintaining loyalty to one alcohol shop it means they have your address and a list of your favourite drinks which translates to fast deliveries since there no direction inquires and easier means of ordering by saying something like this, “bring me the same”.

In Conclusion, let’s all enjoy our whisky responsibly to avoid road fatalities this festive season. We still need you guys next year and your families need you more. Call out for drinks delivery Nairobi and let that bottle of whisky that gives you hope and energy to face life find its way to your house in minutes. Dial a drink today and enjoy being born in the 21st century.

Cheers!

#KeepItDrinksDeliveryKenya.
